reviews.review_msg: hes great!

The lecture has been recorded in advance, so you can study by yourself via his notes and slides. I didn't visit the school for this course all semester, but he gave one paper to read weekly, its very helpful to connect the course. He always replied to emails quickly and detailly, and He is generous with assignments extension.
Highly recommend!

Lance is exceptionally passionate about what he teaches and made even the dull subject matter interesting to learn. He explains concepts thoroughly and seems to really enjoy teaching. My only complaint would be that the workload and the amount of reading and supplementary material was overwhelming at times, but the deadlines were fair.
Best prof in SFU Geog hands down. True gem. You learn so much and he knows so much it's fantastic. Never saw a teacher so actively engaged in everyone's learning. Fantastic.

His class was information heavy but truly inspiring and I actually learned so many things. He focuses on critical thinking NOT critical theory like 90%+ of other profs in the dep., so you actually learn multiple aspects and understand the complexity of the world. 100% would take again.

It's not even a writing class, and we have to write one short and one long paper for it. The worst thing is that for the short paper, he wants you to find articles online on a specific topic, but he won't tell you what articles. Basically, you are guessing, which takes too much time to do.

One of my favorite profs. This course wasnt an easy A, but the topics were interesting and all the readings and lectures were laid out clearly. Lance is really kind and receptive to questions, and the learning expectations were totally reasonable. 10/10 would recommend.

Really knowledgable and respectful. Caters the lectures to that specific class's speed/understanding. Fair grader and very interested in the topics he teaches. Great prof all around. But be ready to write a 10-15 page research paper as well as do a presentation on it 2-3 weeks before it's due! Great sample writing material for job apps though.
Caring professor who is easily and happy to be accessible outside and after classes. Helps you with whatever you need help with, and is perfectly reasonable given any circumstances. Very passionate.
One of the best profs I have had during my time at SFU. Friendly, knowledgeable, and always willing to help. The course was enjoyable and I would recommend this prof.

The lectures are good and enlightening. He nerds out every so often when he gets excited about a particular subject, but you can see the passion he has for the material. It really makes you respect his teaching ability. Labs were easy, watched videos and reflected on them and the readings. Exam is also easy if you study and pay attention in class.

Is very nice as he tries to give you a helping hand when you ask for it. Will try his best to answer your questions without giving you answers so at times it may not be too much information of help. Posts lectures online but may need to attend class to write your own notes.

Very passionate about his subjects and makes a lot of lame jokes. Lectures seem slow sometimes when he asks questions and waits for a response, but this does not take away from the material. Copy slides and take notes from class discussions and you should do well. Exam was easy if you studied. Start the 15 page term paper as early as possible!!!!!

Great that he wants us to learn to make scientific guesses, but more help with how to develop a good background to do so would be valuable. He's great to talk to, but lectures are a bit random. I guess he's tired of teaching the same old course? I'd rather be guided and pushed a bit more. Time is too short to spend it flailing.

Lance is a very nice guy and seems very passionate about limnology but the class was very disorganized. no midterm, only presentation, term paper, and final and lab assignments. It was very hard to figure out what to study for or how to answer test questions. Same with the paper, very vague and broad topics given. DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS ALONE!

midterms were hard!! atleast when u realize your grade on it.this class requires hell lot of reading ,so don't rely on his lectures notes only bcz ur gonna end up failing if u do so. His teaching style is strange, as he asks more than he tells. Also ,i had no interest what so ever prior to class .ur 1st midterm mark is going to reflect final mark.

Funny, nice, helpful professor but his lectures don't always cover everything you need for the exam, so reading is a must. His posted notes are VERY incomplete, and there are no lecture recordings so lecture is pretty much mandatory. Tutorials are interesting, but for the most part useless because they don't really review lecture material.

If you are exited about the material and you participate in the discussions you will love his class, if your just there to get the notes and learn the material by yourself later you will do poorly.  he is very much a "discussion" style teacher.  the people who rate him negatively probably didn't put much effort into the actual lecture.

No good notes. Lectures are scattered... he gives out 80% of the questions on the final, but there are no resources to figure out these questions, and nothing was taught very well in class, especially the topics that were new. Bad teacher.

He's fine. His notes suck and he's completly scatered but it doesnt matter too much. He gives you literally 80% of the questions that will appear on the final beforehand so its not a big deal. Still got an A. Don't buy any texts. I never did the readings adn still got an A+.

Lance really wants you to excited about what he's teaching.  His lecture notes that you could get before lecture really helped since the textbooks were pretty useful.  Marking was fair, and movies in every tutorials were relaxing

Topics were not well related to lectures and seminars were mostly irrelevant.  It's highly recommended that students select their term paper topics ASAP, as topics were inadequate.  Diminishing class size reflects his teaching ability.
He's a good lecturer and he outlines everything and makes even complex topics not that hard to understand. Exams were fair.. he even told us some of the possible questions in advance.

took both, and struggled in both to stay awake. Brilliant researcher, but his lectures are scattered, ranging from way to simple to lacking fundamentals. Just wait until he gets out the balloons! (oh, and I didn't say this but ask for an extension!)
Not bad.  Very knowledgable and passionate but not very helpful individually.  Pretty decent lecturer and his projects are challenging.
